II WESTERN PROVINCE AGRARIAN SERVICES AUTHORITY DRAFT STATUTE

... ( ... ) (The Hon. Alhaj A.H.M. Azwer) Hon. Speaker, on behalf of the Chairman of Standing Committee B, I present the Report of Standing Committee B on the Western Province Agrarian Services Authority Draft Statute.

Your Committee considered the "Western Province Agrarian Services Authority" draft statute of the Western Province Provincial Council, and requested an extension of time till 30 November 2011 as the Committee is unable to report its observation to Parliament within the time period given in the Standing Order No. 46 A(3)(b)".
. . Ordered to lie upon the Table.
. Petitions ordered to be referred to the Committee on Public Petitions.
ORAL ANSWERS TO QUESTIONS : : VOLUNTARY TEACHERS IN SOUTHERN PROVINCE : ABSORPTION TO TEACHERS' SERVICE 0931/10
(a) Is he aware that a group of teachers have been serving
on voluntary basis for nearly 10 years by now in schools in the Southern Province without receiving any payment for their work?
(i) separately the names of teachers who serve in the above mentioned manner and the number of such teachers at educational zone level ;
(ii) the subjects for which those teachers were recruited; and
(iii) the methodology adopted for recruiting them ?
(c) Will he admit that the voluntary teachers who served in other Provinces of the Island have been absorbed to the Teachers' Service ?
(i) whether action will be taken to absorb the voluntary teachers in the Southern Province into
(ii) the period of time taken for it ?

asked the Minister of Economic Development:
(i) the measures taken by the Government to alleviate poverty in Sri Lanka;
(ii) the number of families covered through those measures; and
(iii) whether the targets set for alleviating poverty have been successfully achieved through the programmes implemented by the present Government?

() , ? asked the Minister of Economic Development:
(i) the number of families whose monthly Samurdhi assistance is less than Rs.. 1,000/-
(ii) the amount of money allocated for Samurdhi assistance in year 2010; and
(iii) the amount of money allocated for Samurdhi assistance in year 2011?
(b) Will he inform this House whether, as stated in the Mahinda Chinthana-
(i) the Samurdhi assistance of all those families that received less than Rs 1000/- has been increased up to Rs. 1000/-
(ii) arrangements are made to provide each family with children below 3 years of age with a supplementary assistance of Rs. 1,500/- and
(iii) arrangements are made to provide each Samurdhi family unit with a loan upto Rs. 100,000/- in order to provide the required capital for running a business or engaging in an occupation ?

MONEY SPENT ON DEYATA KIRULA EXHIBITION 2011: MINISTRY OF INDUSTRY AND COMMERCE 1248/11 5.
() , ? asked the Minister of Industry and Commerce:
(a) Will he state the total amount of money spent by the Ministry of Industry and Commerce on the "Deyata Kirula" exhibition in 2011
(i) separately, the expenditure borne by each institution and department of the Ministry on that exhibition;
(ii) the functions carried out by those institutions and departments; and
(iii) separately, the amount of money spent on each of those functions?
(c) Will he state the Head of Expenditure of the Ministry out of which funds were allocated from the last Budget for the above mentioned expenses?

() , ? asked the Minister of Local Government and Provincial Councils:
(a) Will he state the total amount of money spent by the Ministry of Local Government and Provincial Councils on the "Deyata Kirula" exhibition in 2011?
(i) separately, the expenditure borne by each institution and department of the Ministry on that exhibition;
(ii) the functions carried out by those institutions and departments; and
(iii) separately, the amount of money spent on each of those functions?
(c) Will he state the Head of Expenditure of the Ministry out of which funds were allocated from the last Budget for the above mentioned expenses?
( - , ) (The Hon. Indika Bandaranayake - Deputy Minister of Local Government and Provincial Councils) , .
: : RENOVATION OF WEKEVILA ANICUT : MONEY ALLOCATED
() , ? asked the Minister of Irrigation and Water Resources Management:
(i) the Wekevila anicut which provides water to about 150 acres of paddy lands situated in the Kamburupitiya Divisional Secretary's Division in the Matara District is not properly maintained; and
(ii) as a result, the farmers in the aforesaid area have faced severe hardships as they are unable to obtain water required for their cultivation purposes?
(i) whether steps will be taken to fulfil the water requirements of the farmers by renovating the Wekevila anicut expeditiously;
(ii) whether funds have been allocated for that purpose by now;
(iii) if so, the amount of money that has been allocated; and
(iv) if the renovation work is started, the date on which it will be done?
( .. - , ) (The Hon. W.B. Ekanayake - Deputy Minister of Irrigation and Water Resources Management) , .
.. ( .. ) (The Hon. W.B. Ekanayake) . ( ) (The Hon. Buddhika Pathirana) , . , .

asked the Minister of Power and Energy:
(i) the total power generation in the country and its percentage of hydro and thermal power; and
(ii) the quantity of thermal power generated by the CEB and the private sector ?
(i) the production cost of electricity generated by the CEB, including amortization, interest charges and loan repayments;
(ii) the unit price of the thermal power generated and the contracted period to provide it by the private sector to the CEB;
(iii) whether there is any clause on default payments in the agreements on buying of thermal power;
(iv) whether there is any development activities based on solar power and wind power; and
(v) if there is no such activities, the reasons for not using those renewable energy sources?
(c) Will he inform this House the average unit price of-
(i) power generated by the State sector;
(ii) purchasing from the private sector; and
(iii) selling for the commercial sector and the domestic consumers ?

: / : / MINISTRY OF CIVIL AVIATION BUILDING : RENT/LEASE
() , ? asked the Minister of Civil Aviation:
(i) of the place in which the Ministry of Civil Aviation is located at present;
(ii) whether the aforesaid place has been obtained on permanent, rent or lease basis; and
(iii) if it has been obtained on rent basis, the amount of money paid for it monthly?
(i) whether there is an arrangement to shift the Ministry of Civil Aviation to another place;
(ii) if so, what that new place is;
(iii) whether the said place has been obtained on rent or lease basis;
(iv) if so, the amount of money that has to be paid for it monthly;
(v) the period of time for which the aforesaid place has been obtained on rent or lease basis; and
(vi) the name of the owner of the building mentioned above?
( - ) (The Hon. Piyankara Jayaratne - Minister of Civil Aviation) , .
: , : ADVISERS UNDER MINISTRY OF CO-OPERATIVES AND INTERNAL TRADE : DETAILS
6. ( ) ( - ) (The Hon. Sunil Handunnetti on behalf of the Hon. Ajith Kumara) - (1) :
asked the Minister of Co-operatives and Internal Trade:
(i) the number of advisers who serve under the Ministry of Co-operatives and Internal Trade at present;
(ii) their names, educational qualifications and responsibilities;
(iii) the salaries and allowances paid to them; and
(iv) the total of all the allowances paid during the previous month?
(i) of the names of the advisers to whom official vehicles have been provided, the number of official vehicles provided and the details of those vehicles; and
(ii) separately of the fuel allowance provided to each adviser, if they are provided with a fuel allowance?
(i) the names of the advisers to whom telephone facilities have been provided by now, if telephone facilities are provided to them;
(ii) separately of the amount of the telephone allowance paid to each adviser, if they are paid a telephone allowance?
( - , ) (The Hon. Johnston Fernando - Minister of Co-operatives and Internal Trade) , * . * : * : * Answer tabled:

(ii) their names, educational qualifications and responsibilities;
(iii) the salaries and allowances paid to them; and
(iv) the total of all the allowances paid during the previous month?
(i) of the names of the advisers to whom official vehicles have been provided, the number of official vehicles provided and the details of those vehicles; and
(ii) separately of the fuel allowance provided to each adviser, if they are provided with a fuel allowance?
(i) the names of the advisers to whom telephone facilities have been provided by now, if telephone facilities are provided to them; and
(ii) separately of the amount of the telephone allowance paid to each adviser, if they are paid a telephone allowance?

() ( ) (The Hon. (Dr.) Sarath Amunugama) Hon. Member, in the year 2005, we gave jobs to all the graduates including all those in the North and the East. You have to accept that. Your leaders have also accepted that in the year 2005, we gave jobs to 55,000 graduates in Sri Lanka and that included all the graduates in the North and the East. After that, all over the country there has been a natural increase of unemployed graduates. I do not deny it. But, you cannot say that graduates were not given jobs.
... ( ... ) (The Hon. Alhaj A.H.M. Azwer) Even now steps are being taken to give jobs to graduates.
() ( ) (The Hon. (Dr.) Sarath Amunugama) Yes. So, it is not fair. Do not bring a racial element into this. - [Interruption.]
( ) (Mr. Deputy Chairman of Committees) Order, please! Hon. Minister, what he is saying is that some Ministers have given those on a quota system. That is what he is questioning.

() ( ) (The Hon. (Dr.) Sarath Amunugama) No, no. As far as 2005 is concerned, there was no quota system. All the graduates were given employment. . So, it is not fair. After that there have been problems. There are problems in other areas also. You have to accept that.

() ( ) (The Hon. (Dr.) Sarath Amunugama) Hon. Member, that problem is there in all the areas, not only in the North and the East. In every province, even in the Central Province, there is that extra number which we have to look into. . ( . ) (The Hon P. Ariyanethran) ! 2005 , . quota ? "", "" !
... ( ... ) (The Hon. Alhaj A.H.M. Azwer) Sir, I rise to a point of Order.

( ) (Mr. Deputy Chairman of Committees) Order, please! There is a point of Order being raised. Hon. Azwer, what is the point of Order? ... ( ... ) (The Hon. Alhaj A.H.M. Azwer) ! . , . 1,500 . , 15,000 - 20,000 . , .

. ( . . ) (The Hon. Mavai S. Senathirajah) The Members representing the North and the East are requesting for employment for the graduates who have passed out in the last five years; that is, after 2005. They are still unemployed.

() ( ) (The Hon. (Dr.) Sarath Amunugama) I know there is a problem but it is not confined only to the North and the East. That problem is there throughout the Island. That is what I am saying. We are trying to address it. Even in the next Budget, we will try to address it. What I want to emphasize is that it is not a problem only for the North and the East. It is a problem everywhere.
( ) ( - , ) (The Hon. Rohitha Abeygunawardana - Deputy Minister of Ports and Highways) , , () .

, BREAKDOWN IN LAW AND ORDER OF THE COUNTRY [. . 4.28 ] ( ) (The Hon. John Amaratunga) Sir, I move,

Recent events have shown that there is an alarming breakdown in Law and Order in the country. Gun-toting gangs are running around the country intimidating the populace and in several instances resulting in deaths. Apart from anything else this is threatening the entire democratic process in the country. It appears that very many of these unlawful gangs enjoy political patronage and the law enforcement authorities are helpless.
Will the Hon. Prime Minister inform this House what steps the Government intends taking to arrest this situation before the whole country ends up in total anarchy?"
Sir, now please permit me to speak a few words in Sinhala.
( - ) (The Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe - Leader of the Opposition) , . , . , , . . , . . . . . . , . . . - - .
. , ; 2/3 . . . . ; . ? . , . . , ; . , . ; . . . . They are taking the law into their own hands; that is dangerous. .
